unnormalised: **What are some yoga practices that have significantly improved your life?**
normalised: **What are some yoga practices that have significantly improved your life?**

unnormalised: Okay, so, I’m no Dr. Chopra, but I can definitely share what's worked wonders for me on my yoga journey! I started a few years ago, mostly because my back was killing me after long hours at work (thanks, corporate life!).
normalised: Okay, so, I'm no Doctor Chopra, but I can definitely share what's worked wonders for me on my yoga journey! I started a few years ago, mostly because my back was killing me after long hours at work (thanks, corporate life!).

unnormalised: Initially, I just focused on basic Asanas. Surya Namaskar, of course, is a game changer. Seriously, 10 rounds in the morning and I feel so much more energized. Then I slowly incorporated Pranayama, especially Anulom Vilom. It’s supposed to balance your energies – kinda like balancing your chakras, you know?
normalised: Initially, I just focused on basic Asanas. Surya Namaskar, of course, is a game changer. Seriously, ten rounds in the morning and I feel so much more energized. Then I slowly incorporated Pranayama, especially Anulom Vilom. It's supposed to balance your energies – kinda like balancing your chakras, you know?

unnormalised: What I’ve found really helpful is tailoring my practice to my needs. Some days, it’s a high-intensity Vinyasa flow to sweat out the stress. Other days, it's a gentle restorative session with lots of supported poses, perfect for when I'm feeling overwhelmed. I try to practice at least 3-4 times a week, even if it's just a quick 15-minute session in my tiny 200 sq ft Mumbai apartment.
normalised: What I've found really helpful is tailoring my practice to my needs. Some days, it's a high-intensity Vinyasa flow to sweat out the stress. Other days, it's a gentle restorative session with lots of supported poses, perfect for when I'm feeling overwhelmed. I try to practice at least three to four times a week, even if it's just a quick fifteen-minute session in my tiny two hundred square feet Mumbai apartment.

unnormalised: I also learned some simple mudras, like Gyan Mudra during meditation. It supposedly helps with concentration. And while I can’t quantify that with hard numbers, I *feel* more focused.
normalised: I also learned some simple mudras, like Gyan Mudra during meditation. It supposedly helps with concentration. And while I can't quantify that with hard numbers, I *feel* more focused.

unnormalised: Another tip: don't be afraid to experiment! There are so many different styles, from Ashtanga to Yin. Find what resonates with you. I’m even thinking about joining a yoga retreat in Rishikesh sometime next year – heard it's amazing!
normalised: Another tip: don't be afraid to experiment! There are so many different styles, from Ashtanga to Yin. Find what resonates with you. I'm even thinking about joining a yoga retreat in Rishikesh sometime next year – heard it's amazing!

unnormalised: My back pain is significantly reduced, my stress levels are lower, and I just generally feel calmer and more balanced. Definitely worth exploring! What about you? Share your experiences! I'm always looking for new inspo! Plus, maybe you could help me spend less on physio! (Rs. 500 per session is killing my budget!).
